festival.introText:
Glasgow's hard dance and trance spectacular Coloursfest returns in 2023 for a huge summer party with the Scottish raving staple coming together on 2023 date tbc.

Easily one of the most eagerly anticipated events in the calendar, Coloursfest has been combining dons of dance music with mind blowing production for nearly two decades, and this year will be every bit the same - if not better.

The long-running festival boasts a whopping five stages, which will be soundtracked by international, genre defining acts alongside the scene’s most promising talent.

Expect a plethora of the leading names in big room, trance and hard dance to take the gigantic roof off Glasgow’s amazing Braehead Arena.
festival.descriptionText: Skiddle is an official ticket outlet of Coloursfest 2023. Get Coloursfest tickets, news and information with Skiddle.com

reviews.title: Review of Coloursfest 2022
reviews.body: Trance tent is amazing. spend my entire day there. Atmosphere & crowd in there is just perfection

reviews.title: Review of Coloursfest 2022
reviews.body: been to thus event so meny time and absolute amazing day/night and doesn't disappoint only thing was the queue for the drinks need to be more organised

faqs.question: When is Coloursfest 2023?
faqs.answer: Colourfest returns to Braehead Arena, Saturday 5th of August 2023.

faqs.question: How much are Coloursfest tickets?
faqs.answer: Tickets start from £45 + booking fee.

faqs.question: How do I get to Coloursfest?
faqs.answer:
By Bus

Braehead has its own dedicated bus station and travel information centre. In fact over 820 buses pass through here every day. There are direct services from many locations including Glasgow city centre, Paisley, Renfrew, Erskine and Glasgow Airport.

To plan your journey by bus, please visit Transport Direct. If you are traveling by public transport within Scotland, you can also use the Traveline Scotland journey planner.

By Coach

If you are coming by coach, then we also have our own dedicated coach park next to the bus station. Please contact the arena if you are arriving with a coach party as some events have specific coach drop off points.

By Car

Braehead Arena can easily be reached by road from the whole of central Scotland and beyond.

The venue has over 6500 dedicated FREE parking spaces. We are based at junction 26 (eastbound) and junction 25a (westbound) of Glasgow's M8 motorway.

Please visit Transport Direct to plan your journey by car.

By Train

Our nearest railway station is Paisley Gilmour Street. From there, you can catch one of the many regular buses to Braehead. If you are traveling through Glasgow city centre, then it is best to catch a bus from the city centre.

The closest underground stop to Braehead is Govan, from where there are frequent buses. The journey time is around 12 minutes.

For train times please use the National Rail website.

By Air

Braehead Arena is conveniently situated just four miles from Glasgow International Airport. For more information on flights to Glasgow visit the Glasgow Airport website at www.glasgowairport.com.

 

The First Bus 747 service offers a direct link from Glasgow Airport to Braehead and Xscape. It runs every 30 minutes for most of the day and the journey time to Braehead is around 15 minutes. For timetable details, please use our Braehead journey planner.

faqs.question: Where is Coloursfest?
faqs.answer: Coloursfest is located in Braehead Arena which is around 7 miles from Glasgow city centre. It takes about 20 minutes from the city centre by bus or car. The postcode is G51 4BN.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

 

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does Coloursfest have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Coloursfest is a non camping festival so camping equipment is not needed. It is however close to Glasgow City Centre so there is plenty of alternative accommodation to choose from.

faqs.question: How do I get to Coloursfest?
faqs.answer:
By Car - The venue is just off the M8, if you’re heading from Glasgow come off at Junction 25A and follow the signposts to the Arena. 

By Bus - There are several regular bus services operated by, McGills, First Glasgow, Stagecoach (West Scotland) and Colchri.

By Rail - There are regular train services from Paisley Gilmour Street, Glasgow Central/Queen Street (National Rail), Partick (National Rail and SPT Subway), Govan (SPT Subway).

faqs.question: Does Coloursfest have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes you must be 18 or over to attend Coloursfest. You may be asked to show photo ID.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Coloursfest?
faqs.answer: You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into Coloursfest. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival, serving up organic, vegetarian and vegan options.
